intro: Adenocalymma pseudopatulum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Adenocalymma pseudopatulum is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
